thread.title: Blue Jays change stadium beer policy for ALCS Game 3
thread.title_full: Blue Jays change stadium beer policy for ALCS Game 3

author: Nick Schwartz
title: Blue Jays change stadium beer policy for ALCS Game 3
text:
Blue Jays change stadium beer policy for ALCS Game 3 USA Today Sports 6 hrs ago Nick Schwartz © Provided by USA Today Sports Darren Calabrese/The Canadian Press via AP The Blue Jays escaped a thrilling Game 5 of the ALDS last week against the Rangers by scoring four runs in a wild seventh inning — but a controversial call earlier in the game caused many irate Blue Jays fans to foolishly toss cans of beer and trash onto the field. Texas took a 3-2 lead when catcher Russell Martin thew a ball off Shin-Soo Choo’s bat to allow a freak run, and Jays fans inside the Rogers Centre erupted.
AdChoices One fan was arrested after tossing a can that sprayed beer on a baby.
#BlueJays players urging fans to stop throwing stuff. Looks like a fan with a baby got hit by debris. This is ugly. pic.twitter.com/opQECKMtWw
— Casey Pratt (@CaseyPrattCSN) October 14, 2015
With the Blue Jays trailing the Royals 0-2 in the ALCS, the series returns to the Rogers Centre Monday night — and a new alcohol policy will be in place for Game 3.
Via the National Post :
“Blue Jays fans sitting in the 500 level of Rogers Centre for tonight’s playoff game against Kansas City will have to settle for drinking their favourite tipple out of a plastic cup.
The team says beer sold in the upper tier of the stadium will not be available in cans during Game 3 of the American League Championship series.”
Go to MSN Home
